page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: All of the old buildings which were mentioned on pages 10 & 11 were either built in the{nineteenth}century or the early{twentieth}century. This is apart from Rowheath Farmhouse. These buildings are exceptions because most of the buildings (about 50%) were built after World War II and the almost all the rest between the wars. The large building increase is due to the influx of people which one local inhabitant said was considerable in the{'50s}and{'60s}.The reason for this is probably the cheapness of living in such a rural area despite the fact that it is within 10 minutes of Clacton. In the questionaire some said that the expense was their reason for living in the area. Others said that it was peaceful and there were still a number of old buildings to see.
